#Text=Belgrave
#Text=Belgrave is a city in Yarra Valley , east of Melbourne .
#Text=Belgrave is a suburb in Melbourne , 35 km east from central business district .
#Text=Its Local Government Area is the Shire of Yarra Ranges .
#Text=At the 2006 Census , Belgrave had a population of 4094 .
#Text=Belgrave was first settled in 1851 , it is only 16 years younger than Melbourne .
#Text=Belgrave was named after an 1840s chapel in Leeds , Yorkshire , England ; the name carried by Mr and Mrs R.G. Benson when they came to Melbourne in 1856 .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Melbourne head east along Burwood Hwy .
#Text=From Gippsland and Mornington Peninsula head north along Belgrave-Hallam Rd .
#Text=By train
#Text=Belgrave is the final station on the Belgrave line .
#Text=Travel from Melbourne takes approximately 1 hour .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Hiking and cycling are popular activities in the area and a visitor can appreciate much by choosing one of these methods of transportation .
#Text=Adjacent to the Belgrave train station is the major bus terminus for the area with multiple routes servicing the local areas .
#Text=There is plenty of parking and much of the hinterland is accessible by car .
#Text=See
#Text=Every year , usually on the Saturday closest to the Winter solstice ( late June ) a Winter Lantern Festival is held along the main street of Belgrave .
#Text=People are encouraged to make a lantern and bring it along where a procession is then held to light up the night sky .
#Text=Do
#Text=Puffing Billy historic steam train commences its journey from Belgrave .
#Text=The train station follows on from the suburban train line .
#Text=There are various National Parks in the area , all accessible by car or foot .
#Text=Sherbrooke Forest ( 1km out of Belgrave on the Monbulk Road ) .
#Text=A unique and ecologically valuable example of sub-tropical rain forest .
#Text=The flora and fauna are broad and varied ; the forest of great white Victorian mountain ash ( the world 's tallest tree species ) and giant tree ferns .
#Text=If you walk quietly , especially around dawn you may hear and even be privileged to glimpse the Male Lyrebird 's dance .
#Text=Be sure to include Sherbrooke falls on your walk through this tranquil forest .
#Text=Belgrave Adventure Tree Park is situated approximately 500 metres from the town centre .
#Text=The Cameo Cinemas are the local cinemas and are set in an attractive art deco era building .
#Text=During summer there are also outdoor cinema sessions held .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Belgrave has an eclectic mix of small shops as well as a supermarket , post office , bakery and organic shop .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Earthly Pleasures Cafe .
#Text=The Green Bean ( cafe ) .
#Text=India Gate restaurant .
#Text=Micawbers Tavern ( app 1km east of town centre on Monbulk Rd ) .
#Text=Puffing Billy Cafe .
#Text=Reel ( adjacent to the cinema ) .
#Text=Sushi Train .
